editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: HUGH OF ST VICTOR, AUGUSTINE &c.; S. XV med., S. XIV

msItem.p: fols. ii-iv blank. fol. irv is a waste leaf from a slightly larger book of similar date to I, written upside down in 2 cols, lacking decoration. From near the beginning of a grammatical treatise. On fol. ivv is a neat and formal table of contents to the whole book, using the foliation.

physDesc.p: Two separate books, together soon after the writing of I.

supportDesc.extent: 360 leaves (iv + 356) 210 140 The edges savagely retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A4, 1–358, 364, 37–408 / 41–312, B4; catchwords; quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form, mostly cropped. Two quires were missing after 40 before the present binding.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position.

history.provenance: Made in England, probably not at the College long before 1600. At the head of fol. 355 is ‘prec’ xxx s.’, s. xv.

Near the head of fol. i is the James no. ‘4’ (wrongly), twice, s. xvii in. On fol. ivvis the College bookplate and ‘N. 4. 10. Art:’, s. xvii, repeated inside the front board, where it is canc. and replaced with ‘C. 1. 10 (XLIX)’ in red. ‘10’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 33–4; Powicke, no. 1249; Römer 2. 306; Alexander & Temple, no. 537.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Archa Noe Morali et Mystica
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber primus Hugonis de Sancto Victore de archa Noe
msItem.incipit: Cum sederem aliquando in conuentu fratrum
msItem.explicit: affectum suum prouocet. Sit Deus benedictus ...
msItem.note: In five books. PL 176, 617–704; ed. P. Sicard (Paris, 1984); Goy, pp. 226, 241.

msItem.author: Ps.-BERNARD OF CLAIRVAUX
Ps.-Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Bona Conscientia
msItem.incipit: Domus hec in qua habitamus ex omni parte ruinam minatur

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Adnotationes Elucidatoriae in Threnos Ieremiae
msItem.rubric: Exposicio magistri H. super lamentaciones Ieremie
msItem.incipit: Quomodo sedet ...; Quantum ad litteram spectat desolacionem Ierusalem

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: short pieces

msItem.rubric: Sermo Hugonis
msItem.incipit: Cum esset Iesus annorum duodecim et cetera. Sicut mundus iste dupliciter seruit homini
Qui habitatis terram cum panibus occurrite fugienti. Quare f. scripture sacre tanto opere nobis fugam persuadet
msItem.note: Victorine: also in Paris, Bibl. S. Genev. 2656, and Bibl. de l’Arsenal 854, fol. 34v (Schneyer, 6. 517)

msItem.incipit: Ignoscite michi. Vnum est in quo peccasse me fateor ecce nunc dico plus de uobis
msItem.note: pr., from this and Elverum, Folkebibl. 1, fols. 90v-1v (s. xii2, English), by L. Gjerl∅w, RB 82 (1972), 329–30.

msItem.incipit: Dilecto fratri R. H. peccator.
Caritas nunquam excidit. Audierat hoc
msItem.explicit: et ora pro me. Dominus Iesus Christus tecum sit

msItem.incipit: Dominis et patribus reuerendis canonicis Lucensibus

msItem.note: (3)-(5) are found, in the same order, in the Elverum MS: Gjerl∅w, pp. 329–31.

msItem.author: REMIGIUS OF AUXERRE
msItem.title: De Oratione Dominica
msItem.note: (part of De Celebratione Missae, which is Liber de Diuinis Officiis, c. 40)
msItem.rubric: De dominica oratione
msItem.incipit: Pater noster qui es in celis. Hec autem obsecratio oratio dominica uocatur
msItem.explicit: ut liberemur a temptacione dyaboli et tribulacione huius seculi in futuro enim nec diabolus nocebit bonis nec ulla aduersitas exit

msItem.title: Anon., Commentary on the Lord’s Prayer
msItem.incipit: Iacobus apostolus Orate sine intermissione

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.rubric: Sequitur deuota exposicio istius orationis Pater noster
msItem.incipit: Pater. Perfectus amor continetur in hoc uerbo

msItem.rubric: Indiculum omnium scriptorum magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore que scripsit
msItem.note: The unique and authoritative list of Hugh of St Victor’s works, ed. J. de Ghellinck, ‘La table des matières de la première édition des oeuvres de Hugues de Saint-Victor’, Recherches des sciences religieuses 1 (1910), 270–89, 385–96; R. Stammberger, ‘Die Editionen der Werke Hugos von Sankt Viktor durch Abt Gilduin’, in Schrift, Schreiber, Schenker. Studien zur Abtei Sankt Viktor in Paris und den Viktorinern, ed. R. Berndt (Berlin, 2005), pp. 119–231, esp. 119–23, 194–228 (edition), and pls. 1–4.

msItem.rubric: Hugo interroganti respondet super quinque dubitacionibus
msItem.incipit: Insipientem doctus interrogas. Queris quid tibi faciendum sit pro eo quod in habitu religionis positus

msItem.rubric: De tribus locis et quid nos in singulis simus uel agamus
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt loca Egiptus desertum terra promissionis

msItem.rubric: De iudicio ueri et boni. Hugo de Sancto Victore.
msItem.incipit: Spiritalis diudicat omnia. Spiritus s. spiritalem facit ipse spiritus

msItem.rubric: De duabus uoluntatibus in Christo. Hugo de Sancto Victore.
msItem.incipit: Queris de uoluntate Dei et de uoluntate hominis
msItem.note: De Quatuor Voluntatibus in Christo: PL 176. 841–6; Goy, p. 175.

msItem.rubric: Si pares sunt potestas Dei et uoluntas
msItem.incipit: Queritur eciam de potestate Dei si maior est uoluntate eius
msItem.note: De Potestate et Voluntate Dei: PL 176. 839–42; Goy, pp. 177–81 (not this copy).

msItem.rubric: De unione spiritus et corporis
msItem.incipit: Quod natum ex carne caro est
msItem.note: De Vnione Corporis et Spiritus: PL 177. 285–9; Goy, pp. 95–8.

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: De Exterminatione Mali
msItem.rubric: Tractatus sermonis Ricardi de sancto Victore super Quid est tibi mare
msItem.incipit: Quid est tibi mare quod fugisti...; Exclamacio est uox ista prophete cum ammiracione

msItem.author: RICHARD OF ST VICTOR
msItem.title: De Statu Interioris Hominis post Lapsum
msItem.incipit: Sero quidem misi penitenti ...; Inter hec amice amici animi mei
Omne caput languidum ...; Nouit Dominus figmentum
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt tractatus de dictis Ysaie prophete super Omne caput languidum ...
msItem.note: ed. J. Ribaillier in AHDLMA 34 (1967), 61–128; PL 196. 1115–60; Stegmüller, Bibl 7333, not this copy.

msItem.author: JOHN CHRYSOSTOM
msItem.title: De Muliere Chananaea
msItem.rubric: Incipit omelia sancti Iohannis episcopi Constantinopolitani de muliere chananea sub persecucionis figura
msItem.incipit: Multe tempestates et inquietudo aeris

msItem.title: ‘Augustinus de uanitate seculi et de die iudicii et de penis inferni.’
msItem.incipit: F. k. quam tremenda est dies illa in qua Christus redemptor omnium
msItem.explicit: commendo spiritum meum. Respice in me Domine Deus ueritatis et prepara mihi Deus meus ut pace tua dormiam et requiescam qui in Trinitate perfecta uiuis ...
msItem.note: Cf. Serm. app. 251; Römer 1. 378, listing nine English copies including this one.

msItem.author: EUSEBIUS GALLICANUS
msItem.title: Serm. 24
msItem.rubric: Augustinus de beato latrone
msItem.incipit: Deus erat mundi in Christo reconsilians sibi id est diuinitas

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Anima et eius Origine
msItem.incipit: Latro ille non ante
Sed etiam quis non consideret quanta fide quanta spe
msItem.explicit: baptizatum non fuisse quoniam nemo nostrum nouit nemo conuincit

msItem.author: AMBROSE
msItem.title: Sermo in Cena Domini
msItem.rubric: Sermo beati Ambrosii in cena Domini
msItem.incipit: Quoniam hodierna die de latrone fecimus mencionem

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE (PATRICK OF DUBLIN)
msItem.title: De Triplici Habitaculo
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus beati Augustini de gaudiis electorum et suppliciis dampnatorum
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt sub omnipotentis Dei manu habitacula
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Aurelii Augustini doctoris excellentissimi de gaudiis electorum et suppliciis dampnatorum
msItem.note: ed. A. Gwynn (Scriptores Latini Hiberniae 1: Dublin, 1955), pp. 106–25.

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Honestate Mulieris (Serm. app. 293)
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de honestate mulierum
msItem.incipit: Nemo dicat fratres quod corporibus nostris
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber beati Augustini de societate et familiaritate mulierum a clericis precipue uitanda et de eadem materia peropportune scribit beatus Ieronimus ad Oceanum epistola 42 de uita clericorum intitulata que sic incipit Sophronius et Eusebius Ieronimus Oceano salutem

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: Expositio quarundam Propositionum ex Epistola ad Romanos
msItem.note: Preceded by the relevant extract from Retract.
msItem.incipit: Sensus hii sunt in epistola ad Romanos Pauli apostoli
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit exposicio beati Augustini super capitula epistole ad Romanos
msItem.note: CPL 280; CSEL 84 (1971), pp. 1–52, this copy collated as O.

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Opere Monachorum
msItem.note: Preceded by the relevant extract from Retract.
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber sancti Augustini episcopi de opere monachorum
msItem.incipit: Iussioni tue sancte frater Aureli

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Pastoribus (Serm. 46)
msItem.rubric: Augustinus de pastoribus
msItem.incipit: Spes tota nostra quia in Christo est
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo beati Augustini egregii doctoris de pastoribus

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Ovibus (Serm. 47)
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo eiusdem de ouibus
msItem.incipit: Verba que cantauimus continent professionem

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Consensu Evangelistarum
msItem.note: Preceded by the relevant extract from Retract.
msItem.incipit: Inter ipsas omnes diuinas auctoritates

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE (NICETAS)
msItem.title: De Psalmodiae Bono
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber sancti Augustini de laude et utilitate spiritalium canticorum que fiunt in ecclesia
msItem.incipit: Dicamus que nobis Deus donare dignatur
msItem.explicit: pronunciantur in psalmo quia ipsi laudabunt Dominum in s. s. amen

msItem.title: Ad Pleguinum de aetatibus mundi
msItem.incipit: Venit ad me ante biduum

msItem.title: Ad Accam
msItem.incipit: Duas mihi pariter dilectissime antistitum

msItem.title: Ad Helmualdum de bissexto
msItem.incipit: Gauisus sum fateor

msItem.title: Ad Accam altera
msItem.incipit: Quoniam quidem prime tue propositioni festinato

msItem.title: Ad Vuicthedum de paschae celebratione
msItem.incipit: Libenter accepi litteras

msItem.title: Ad Egbertum
msItem.incipit: Memini te hesterno dixisse anno

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Sapientia Animae Christi
msItem.rubric: Magister Walterus querit a magistro Hugone quid senciat de anima Christi
msItem.incipit: Hugo sancti Victoris priori G. salutem
Nuper de Parisius ueniens
Magistro Galterio de Mauritania flaua himneis agnum sequi
Petitioni uestre
msItem.note: (ed. L. Ott, Untersuchungen zur theologischen Briefliteratur der Frühscholastik [Münster, 1937], pp. 353–4)
msItem.incipit: Prudenti ac religioso uiro ... G. H. peccator
Aliquociens accidisse comperi
Queritis de anima Christi id est de illo racionali spiritu

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Beatae Mariae Virginitate
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in libro H. de sancto Victore de perpetua uirginitate beate Marie
msItem.incipit: Sancto pontifici G. Hugo uestre humilitatis et seruus
De incorrupta uirginitate matris Domini
msItem.note: ed. and transl. B. Jollès, L’Oeuvre de Hugues de Saint-Victor 2 (Turnhout, 2000), pp. 182–253; Goy, p. 121.
At this point two quires containing an index (signalled in the table of contents) are missing.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with crayon, written in 45–6 long lines. Written space 155 95 .

handDesc.handNote: Several small, neat cursive hands, anglicana, secretary and a mixture.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 1 a 7-line initial in colours and gold, with 3-sided floral border, in English style of s. xv; blue initials flourished in red; red underlining, highlighting and paraphs, which are used for the running heads.

msItem.author: BONAVENTURE
msItem.title: Breviloquium Pauperis seu Compendium Sacrae Scripturae
msItem.incipit: Flecto genua mea ad Patrem domini nostri Iesu Christi
msItem.explicit: donec intrem in gaudium Domini mei qui ...

msItem.incipit: Hora est e somno surgere. Fratres si contingeret
msItem.explicit: quod ut fiat dicte Pater noster
msItem.note: Probably only an extract. The top l. h. corner of the leaf was torn out early and replaced with a patch; the text on fol. 351 was rewritten on it, but not that on the verso, so that this sermon is severely mutilated.

msItem.incipit: Hora est &c. Scitis quod hodie ecclesia letatur de aduentu Domini
msItem.explicit: affectus subpeditare ut ad eius consorcium mereamur peruenere quod ...

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with crayon, written in 52 long lines. Written space 175 105

physDesc.accMat: fols. 353–6 are two bifolia from two larger noted English servicebooks. fols. 353 and 356 a breviary, s. xiii, with red initials; fols. 354–5, a missal, s. xii2, with red and buff initials.
